NodeDetails.Comment: ![CDATA[This is the code for the system which has sourced this message. For request messages, this field has to contain the source code for the partner system as maintained within FLEXCUBE UBS. In case of response messages this field will contain "FLEXCUBE".]]

![CDATA[This is the component of FLEXCUBE for which this message is meant. Gateway supports both FLEXCUBE UBS and FLEXCUBE Investor Services. If the message is for FLEXCUBE UBS then this field should contain "FCUBS" and "FCIS" if meant for FLEXCUBE Investor Services. This field is case-sensitive.]]

![CDATA[This is the "unique" message ID for this message. In inbound messages, if this field is present then Gateway would perform technical duplicate recognition using this field. For all messages going out from Gateway, Gateway will populate a unique message ID in this field.]]

![CDATA[This is the correlation ID for the message. Gateway supports 2 correlation patterns, namely "Message ID to Correlation ID" (M2C) and "Correlation ID to Correlation ID" (C2C). While using asynchronous means of communication (like a JMS queue), the partner system can correlate the response received from Gateway to the request message sent by it using this field. If the correlation pattern is M2C then this field will contain the MSGID of the request message. If the correlation pattern is C2C then this field will contain the CORRELID of the request message.]]
![CDATA[This is the user id which will be used within FLEXCUBE to record the transaction. This needs to be a valid user id as maintained within FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This is the Branch of FLEXCUBE where the transaction would be recorded. This needs to be a valid Branch code as maintained in FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This field is applicable only if messages are being sent to FCIS using Gateway. This is the module id of FCIS where the transaction will be recorded.]]
![CDATA[This field should contain the code of the Service of FLEXCUBE which is being requested. This field is case-sensitive.]]
![CDATA[This is the operation of the service which is being invoked. This field is case-sensitive.]]

![CDATA[This is the code for the operation being invoked in the Source system. The code of Source Operation being sent needs to be maintained as a valid Source Operation for the Source within FLEXCUBE.]]
![CDATA[This is the user id in the Source system who is performing the action.]]

![CDATA[This the system for which this message is destined. In case of request messages to FLEXCUBE, it should be "FLEXCUBE". In case of response, the SOURCE from the request message is reproduced here.]]

![CDATA[In response messages, this is the ID sent by FLEXCUBE in case any overrides are encountered. In request messages, the source system is expected to reproduce the MULTITRIPID from the earlier received response if the source system accepts the overrides.]]
![CDATA[This is the function in FLEXCUBE which is being invoked. For integration scenarios this need not be sent. This is used by FLEXCUBE native user interface.]]
![CDATA[This is the action on the function being invoked. For integration scenarios this need not be sent. This is used by FLEXCUBE native user interface.]]
![CDATA[In response messages, FLEXCUBE will indicate the status of the request in this field. The various values are "SUCCESS", "WARNING" and "FAILURE".]]
![CDATA[Booking date of the loan, which cannot be modified.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the Frequency Unit Daily : D Monthly : M Weekly:W Yearly :Y QUARTERLY :Q Half Yearly :H Bullet :B]]
![CDATA[Schedule due date of the First Installment.]]
![CDATA[The Loan Value date at the time of Loan creation.]]
![CDATA[Indicates Cheque Book Facility Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Amend Past Paid Schedule Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Automatic Teller Machine Facility Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Passbook Facility Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Liquidate Back Valued Schedules Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Bulk Payment Allowed Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Auto Liquidation Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Partial Liquidation Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Auto Liquidation of Track Receivable Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Manual Liquidation of Track Receivable Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates UDE Rollover basis Product : P Contract : C]]
![CDATA[Indicates Schedule Basis Product : P Contract : C]]
![CDATA[Indicates Roll By Days : D Months : M Quarters : Q Semi Annual : S Years : Y]]
![CDATA[Indicates Rollover Type Special : S Custom : C]]
![CDATA[Indicates Clearing Branch Code to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates External Account Number to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates External Account Name to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Clearing Bank Code to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Clearing Branch Code to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Clearing Product Code to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Clearing Product Code to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates GIRO Mode to be debited Auto GIRO : A Manual GIRO : M]]
![CDATA[Indicates GIRO Service to be debited Bank GIRO : B Plus GIRO : P]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Account Number to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Code to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 1 to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 2 to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 3 to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 4 to be debited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Account Number to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Code to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 1 to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 2 to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 3 to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Payer Bank Address 4 to be credited]]
![CDATA[Indicates Auto Liquidated Reversed Payment Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates value of Amortized Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Rollover type whether it is auto or manual Auto : A Manual : M]]
![CDATA[Indicates Credit Payment Mode. CASA ACC Clearing CLG External Account EAC Instrument INS Cash/Teller TLR]]
![CDATA[Indicates Debit Payment Mode. CASA ACC Credit Card CCD Clearing CLG Debit Card DCD External Account EAC Electronic Pay Order EPO GIRO GIR Internal Cheque ICK Instrument INS Cash/Teller TLR]]
![CDATA[Indicates Extenal Account Number of Credit Settlement Mode]]
![CDATA[Indicates Extenal Account Number of Debit Settlement Mode]]
![CDATA[Indicates Funded Status Y for Yes; N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Maturity Type Fixed : F Call : C]]
![CDATA[Indicates Calculate Gross Principal. Y for Yes;N for No]]
![CDATA[Indicates Commitment Type. Revolving : R Non Revolving : N]]
![CDATA[Indicates Allow Rollover Yes : Y No : N]]
![CDATA[Specify the date beyond which the EMI Change (EMIC) will not be processed.]]
![CDATA[Authorization status of the disbursement. A-Authorised, U- Unauthorised.]]
![CDATA[Component Name of the component for which the disbursement is made and schedule maintained.]]
![CDATA[The currency to be used for settlements or liqudations.]]
![CDATA[This flag determines whether the schedule for the component of the loan has to be capitalised. N-No, Y-Yes.]]
![CDATA[On selection of Special Interest type for the component the special Interest Amount is specified in this field.]]
![CDATA[Branch code of the debit settlement account.]]
![CDATA[Branch code of the credit settlement account.]]
![CDATA[The branch code iof the service account.]]
![CDATA[The external bank code as per clearing maintenance (Credit).]]
![CDATA[The branch in of the external bank to be used for clearing (Credit).]]
![CDATA[The external bank code as per clearing maintenance (Debit).]]
![CDATA[The branch in of the external bank to be used for clearing (Debit).]]
![CDATA[No on the instrument presented for clearing (Credit).]]
![CDATA[The end point maintained in the clearing system will be picked up (Credit).]]
![CDATA[If the clearing is using a FLEXCUBE Clearing product then that needs to be entered (Credit).]]
![CDATA[No on the instrument presented for clearing (Debit).]]
![CDATA[The routing no for the selected branch for clearing (Debit).]]
![CDATA[The end point maintained in the clearing system will be picked up (Debit).]]
![CDATA[If the clearing is using a FLEXCUBE Clearing product then that needs to be entered (Debit).]]
![CDATA[This is applicable only for corporate customers and not for individual customers debit accounts.]]
![CDATA[The Bank code from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[The Branch from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Debit).]]
![CDATA[This is applicable only for corporate customers and not for individual customers credit accounts.]]
![CDATA[The Bank code from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[The Branch from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[Specify the address of the bank from which the amount is paid (Credit).]]
![CDATA[It determines if the verification of fund is required or not. Y-Yes, N-No.]]
![CDATA[Indicate that the component is to be considered for IRR calculation for the account. Y/N]]

![CDATA[The type of the Schedule for the Credit AdministrationThe valid schedule types are maintained in the valid table, these values are Principle type, rate type, capital type and disbursement type. P Payment,R Rate Revision,D Disbursement]]
![CDATA[The Values maintained will be normal or moratorium which mean if moratorium the credit interests and charges are not settled but are accrued for a certain period. N Normal, M Moratorium]]
![CDATA[The formula to be used for calculating the repayments.]]
![CDATA[Indicates no of schedules for the component.]]
![CDATA[Select the frequency at which payments are made towards the liability. Daily, Bi-Weekly, Weekly, Bi- Monthly, Monthly, Quaterly, Half-Yearly, Yearly.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the installment unit for the component for the schedule. D-Daily, M-Monthly, Q-Quarterly, H-Half Yearly, Y-Yearly, B-Bullet.]]
![CDATA[This indicates the date till which the product is valid. If there is no date specified then the product is valid forever and hence is open ended]]
![CDATA[This flag determines whether the schedule for the component of the loan has to be capitalised. N-No, Y-Yes.]]
![CDATA[The date from the schedule will be effective from or started from.]]
![CDATA[Effective Date from which the penal rate are going to be effective.]]
![CDATA[The value for the UDE name on which the calculation should happen.]]
![CDATA[Customer ID which has to be attached to the account and assoiciate.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the branch code of the branch in which the linkage is maintained.]]
![CDATA[Reference number of the linkage which will be attached to account.]]
![CDATA[Amount of the Linkage or it can be the value of the linkage attached.]]
![CDATA[Customer ID which has to be attached to the account and assoiciate.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the importance of the advice generation. The priority may be: H High, M Medium, L Low]]
![CDATA[Indicates the transfer type. B - Bank Transfer,C - Customer Transfer,O - Bank Transfer for own A/c,D - Direct Debit Advice,M - MCK,X - None.]]
![CDATA[Flag indicates whether cover details are required or not.]]
![CDATA[Indicates Charge Details. O - Our,B - Beneficiary,U - Shared.]]
![CDATA[Receiver of Message. When no cover message is sent, the receiver is the same as our correspondant.]]
![CDATA[The routing no for the selected branch for clearing.]]
![CDATA[The status of the account.The statuses like ACTIVE, OVER DUE, PAST DUE can be maintained in the Contract status maintenance. These can be referenced to maintain the Loan account statuses]]
![CDATA[Select the currency associated with the liability, from the option list provided.]]
![CDATA[An MIS Head indicates the manner in which the type of entry should be considered for profitability reporting purposes.]]
![CDATA[Indicates the message type : Select an advice from the option list provided]]
![CDATA[Component Name of the component for which the disbursement is made and schedule maintained.]]
![CDATA[Branch code of the debit settlement account.]]
![CDATA[Branch code of the credit settlement account.]]
![CDATA[Amount which is due and to be paid.]]
![CDATA[This indicates the amount of change in EMI amount.]]
![CDATA[This indicates the percentage of changes in EMI amount.]]
![CDATA[Effective Date from which the penal rate are going to be effective.]]
![CDATA[Check this box to apply cycle based interest rate for the product.]]
